newsitem.title: USA: Galoob sees 96 sales $280 mln to $290 mln.
newsitem.headline: Galoob sees 96 sales $280 mln to $290 mln.

text.p: Galoob Toys Inc said Wednesday it expects 1996 consolidated sales to range from $280 million to $290 million, compared to $220 million last year, an increase of 27 percent to 32 percent.
Net earnings for the fourth quarter will be $13.1 million to $13.7 million, the toy company said.
Full-year earnings per share will range from $1.20 to $1.25, excluding a first quarter one-time, non-cash charge of $24.3 million from its stock exchange offer, it said.
Galoob said even the low end of the expected earnings range is double last year's earnings per share of $0.60.

It also said its U.S. retail sales have been 34 percent ahead of last year since Thanksgiving. But because of the shortened holiday season, some retailers have been more cautious than usual about placing re-orders late in the season, Galoob said.
The company said it is confident its momentum will continue, making 1997 another year of "record" sales.
